Dear ICS Spartan Families,

We have some great news to share with you. The Michigan Department of Education announced just this week that every public school student will be able to receive breakfast AND lunch for FREE.

Beginning Tuesday, September 8, all of our students (In-person learning or Virtual/Remote learning) are eligible for free breakfast and free lunch. The only exception to this is students who bring their lunch from home and want to purchase milk. In that case, students will be charged for milk.

Since we do not know how long this will last, we strongly encourage all families to still complete the Free and Reduced Lunch Program Application. Completing this application will ensure eligibility for future free meals. If you have questions about the application or require assistance completing it, please contact our Food Service Department at 810-724-9855. Here is a link to our application website for ICS:
https://icschools.us/departments/lunch_program

The ICS Board officially approved, through Board action, both our start date and our instructional delivery model for the start of school.

Discussion of instructional delivery changes is NOT one of the topics on the upcoming Board of Education agenda.

I hope this information helps you with your focus and planning this week as we approach our start date.

Have a great week! We look forward to seeing our students on August 31!

Tonight at a meeting of the ICS Board of Education, the Board supported ICS Superintendent, Dr. Cameron's recommendation to alter the school year 2020-2021 calendar.

This change was made in order to provide additional time to adequately plan and execute the logistics of virtual programming for approximately 450 of our students.

We want to assure that our staff, students and families are comfortable with, and ready to fully implement, the virtual program to our high standards.

An additional week will allow us to do so.

We will continue to provide both virtual and face-to-face education in the fall with a start date of Monday, August 31, 2020.

The calendar will be posted on our district website tomorrow, August 13. We look forward to servicing all of our students beginning Monday, August 31.

In adherence to guidance from Governor Gretchen Whitmer, the Imlay City School district will be closed between March 16 and April 5.

All events, activities, and athletic programs, including practices, have been cancelled. Child care programs have also been canceled during the shut-down.
All school buildings and facilities are closed to the public, including administrative offices. Some essential district-level personnel will report at this time.

During the shutdown, we will continue to conduct sanitization of classrooms and other high traffic areas and surfaces. Deep cleaning of the buildings will be conducted in preparation for the return of students.

Modified food service will be available during this period of closure. We will communicate times and dates for these services to you on Monday, through the districts’ social media and by phone.

We deeply appreciate your patience and understanding as we work through this situation.

Today in 1904

Theodor Geisel, better known to the world as Dr. Seuss, the author and illustrator of such beloved children’s books as “The Cat in the Hat” and “Green Eggs and Ham,” is born in Springfield, Massachusetts on March 2, 1904. Geisel, who used his middle name (which was also his mother’s maiden name) as his pen name, wrote 48 books–including some for adults–that have sold well over 200 million copies and been translated into multiple languages. Dr. Seuss books are known for their whimsical rhymes and quirky characters, which have names like the Lorax and the Sneetches and live in places like Whoville
